question.text: Select the one that is not related to osteoarthritis.

options.text: In osteoarthritis, large weight-bearing joints are affected.
It is a degenerative joint disease occurring in the late middle age.
It is caused due to excessive formation of uric acid.

solution.text: Gradual decrease in the bone mass can lead to loss of bone cells at the joints. The outer covering-cartilage- at the joint is reduced leading to inflammation and pain which is called as osteoarthritis. This can happen due to old-age or due to regular wear and tear. Sometimes, accumulation of uric acid around joints leads to inflammation. Such inflammation and pain is called a gout.
